snippet: J&R Music, the famous store in Lower Manhattan, closed last week after 43 years, forcing employees like Marty Singer, who had worked there since he was 19, to move on.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column holds that ordinary employees are the true pulse of the stores New Yorkers love to frequent; shares story of Marty Singer, longest-serving employee at J&R Music store in Lower Manhattan, which has closed its doors after 43 years; Singer, who has worked at store since 1977, had worked his way up from security guard to corporate sales manager.
lead_paragraph: J&R Music, the famous store in Lower Manhattan, closed last week after 43 years, forcing employees like Marty Singer, who had worked there since he was 19, to move on.

headline.main: Saying Farewell to a Business That Turned Into an Identity
headline.print_headline: Saying Farewell to a Business That Turned Into an Identity

keywords.value: J & R Music and Computer World
